intro: Varengevillea hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy varengevillea, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of southern France. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a unique, almost fuzzy appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring well-drained and sunny environments. Its flowers, which are small and clustered, often display shades of pink or white, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
